gobblin.util

Class ClassAliasResolver<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.util.ClassAliasResolver<T>

  • public class ClassAliasResolver<T>
extends Object
    A class that scans through all classes in the classpath annotated with Alias and is a subType of subTypeOf constructor argument. It caches the alias to class mapping. Applications can call resolve(String) to resolve a class's alias to its cannonical name.
    Note : If same alias is used for multiple classes in the classpath, the first mapping in classpath scan holds good. Subsequent ones will be logged and ignored.
    Note: For the moment this class will only look for classes with gobblin prefix, as scanning the entire classpath is very expensive.

    • Method Detail

      • resolve

        public String resolve(String possibleAlias)
        Resolves the given alias to its name if a mapping exits. To create a mapping for a class, it has to be annotated with Alias
        Parameters:
        possibleAlias - to use for resolution.
        Returns:
        The name of the class with possibleAlias if mapping is available. Return the input possibleAlias if no mapping is found.

      • resolveClass

        public Class<? extends T> resolveClass(String aliasOrClassName)
                                throws ClassNotFoundException
        Attempts to resolve the given alias to a class. It first tries to find a class in the classpath with this alias and is also a subclass of subtypeOf, if it fails it returns a class object for name aliasOrClassName.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException

      • getAliasMap

        public Map<String,Class<? extends T>> getAliasMap()
        Get the map from found aliases to classes.

      • getAliasObjects

        public List<Alias> getAliasObjects()
